tributes.name: Emeribe Emeka
tributes.relationship: A former boss in Inchcape shipping services, Nigeria
tributes.message: A good heart has stopped breathing, and real gem has gone to meet with our creator. You were a father not only to me, but the entire staffs of Inchcape Shipping. Services, Nigeria. I am still in shock few days back when we heard the news of your demise, and i say may your soul and the souls of all the faithful departed through the mercy of God almighty rest in perfect peace, amen. Your memory lives on. Fare well boss, and continue to rest till we meet to path no more.

tributes.name: Hellen
tributes.message: Our paths crossed as neighbours, growing into a beautiful bond that transcended acquaintances - a true family. Our families shared in life's joys, celebrating precious milestones together. Dear Jose, may your spirit live on. Forever we will treasure these cherished memories.

tributes.name: Gilbert Kituyi
tributes.message: Joseph was such a humble, caring and a trusted friend to be around with. I have lost not only a friend but a 'basakwa'. I cherish the many good times we shared during our days in FSK , an admirable basketballer , sharing good times in the coast in the 90s as BVYG members and many other events.  RIP wandase!

tributes.name: Beryl Sijii
tributes.relationship: Friend / Cherished Client to Grey family
tributes.message:
Some people walk into your life and quietly leave an imprint that lasts forever. Joseph, you were one of them.

From the day you made that first call, you saw something in me‚Äîand you never stopped encouraging it. Your belief in my vision, your mentorship, and your steady support became pillars in my journey. You celebrated every milestone, no matter how small, and you did it with such sincerity.

Though your absence leaves a deep ache, I carry your lessons with me. Thank you for the trust, the laughter, and the unwavering faith. You were a true gift.

Rest peacefully, Joseph. May your family be wrapped in grace and comforted by the love you gave so freely.

tributes.name: Chichy ogutu
tributes.message: Words fail me, indeed life is fickle. We lost touch , but you made an impact in my life when we interacted pale Bandari college as we did our undergraduate. It is unfortunate that you had to leave. See you when our paths cross again.

tributes.name: Raphael Musau
tributes.message: I knew Joseph from the time he was at Inchcape through my dad. Always had a smile on him and always ready to listen and help. He will be greatly missed. Rest in eternal peace my friend üôè.

tributes.name: Ann Nduta
tributes.message: I did not meet him physically but through everything that has been said, o believe I have met him through Andrew. A jolly good fellow

tributes.name: Irshad Adamjee
tributes.message: I still treasure his gift to me of 2005 and the many nice memories of the time spent with the good jovial man. A gem of a person.

tributes.name: Faith Keverenge
tributes.message: He was a brother, a friend, a mentor, a therapist and a motivator. All we are left  with are memories, that I would cherish. Family was so important to him, always suggesting for happy get together, ‚Äúthe children have to know our roots‚Äù, he stated. Having a conversation with him, he was always engaged and involved. Good sense of humour and considerate, mindful and kind. I can‚Äôt even begin to count the impact he had while he was with us on this planet earth. Your wife and children will miss you. Your brothers and sisters will miss you. We will miss you. Sleep well Jose!! ‚ù§Ô∏èüïäÔ∏è

tributes.name: Victoria Kerama
tributes.message: Joseph was very humorous, and valued relationships. Rest in eternal peace

tributes.name: Dr Bwanaheri Lali
tributes.relationship: Former work mate and Best Friend
tributes.message: Ridding vespa from Mwandoni to board cruise vessel Royal Star

tributes.name: Brenda, Maureen, Carol
tributes.message: He was the fav company

tributes.name: Dr G G O Calleb
tributes.message: Fare thee well Joe. May Your Soul rest rest in eternal peace üïäÔ∏è

tributes.name: Chifui
tributes.message: A rare human, heart of Gold i  will miss u bro

tributes.name: Sam
tributes.message:
The dots on Bakulutu and Inner Mbuzi  on a randorm Friday or Saturday meant a nice mbuzi afternoon "chini ya mti " and an afternoon of camaradarie and frendship and our code language 
"Omwana embunu" fare thhe well bro.The Oak has fallen and left  a loud bangüôè

tributes.name: BERNARD EMBARO BEDIE
tributes.relationship: A friend, a cousin and a brother
tributes.message: Let Joseph's heart rest well with Angels.To dada Irene It's well

tributes.name: Billy Olang
tributes.message:
Kind hearted ever smiling gentleman...

I first met him at Mombasa Sports Club in 2000 through his brother Job.

I last met him at Serena Dar Es Salaam and he was his usual self...jovial, ever smiling, full of life and humorous...
My sincere condolences to his family.

tributes.name: Fred shigoli
tributes.message:
Joseph was a great gentleman full of humility and a great manager with a humble smile. 
May God lord rest  his soul in eternal peace in heaven.

tributes.name: David Kyalo
tributes.message:
A true leader with always the best in his heart.

Rest easy bro

tributes.name: Washington Owese
tributes.message: Joseph stood out as a great support whenever there was a difficult shipping situation requiring professional solutions. I got to know Joseph in 2020 when our paths crossed while he was in Inchcape and I in Mitchell Cotts. He provided a fast decision which ensured efficient and successful discharge of a bulk vessel. Your professionalism and social humour shall be missed. Rest well my friend üôè

tributes.name: Collins Odawa
tributes.message: Pep,you were more than friend. I can't describe how painful it is to accept you have departed so soon. The last chat we had with at Missions to seamen still lingers in my mind so fresh. I offered a drink to you and you were like no small bro,it's me to throw a drink to you and you ushered the bar man "mupe mbili on my account " and you left in hoof. Kumbe it was our last encounter.

tributes.name: Josephine
tributes.message:
Luwere Jose Luwere. 
Rest in perfect, perfect peace. 
Your presence was felt on this world. 
May God give strength, wisdom for your absence.

Poleni sana.

tributes.name: Anne
tributes.message: Indeed a good Man is gone...a good Boss is gone. May God's comfort overwhelm his family,working with you was a gift,thanks for all the advises n learning u gave me n many who passed thru ua hands. U were a cheerful Boss n your warm smile is all were left with now to remember. Kwaheri Weloba, kwaheri Boss. ISS n NSM team,well represented their..Asanteniüôè.  Tushkuru sote for sharing a life with this Legend. Mwanga wa milele umwangazie Joseph na Raha ya milele umpe eeh bwana,apumzike kwa Amani üôèüôèüôè

tributes.name: Robert Kerama
tributes.message: Rest in peace, Joseph.You were simply, a jolly good fella!

tributes.name: Juma Tellah
tributes.message: Joseph was an incredible person who always shared a smile with those who interacted with him. My heartfelt condolences to his immediate family and relatives. May the Almighty Allah Subhanna rest his soul in eternal peace.

tributes.name: Kibibi omery
tributes.message: The last time i saw him it was on hospital bed. (Agakhan hospital)hdu... In many testimonies he has been featured as a good man.

tributes.name: Paul Munyao
tributes.message: We pray for the soul of our brother as we celebrate his life. May his soul rest in eternal peace. Irene and the kids, we dedicate you to God at all times.

tributes.name: Emmanuel Okumu
tributes.message: Eternal rest grant unto Joseph;O Lord, and let perpetual light shine upon him. May the Soul of Joseph and the souls of all the faithful departed, through the mercy of God, rest in Peace‚Ä¶.. Amen

tributes.name: Maureen
tributes.message:
On this solemn day.
I take this moment to lift our sister Irene and children  and the entire  baba  weloba's family into  the mighty hands of God. Father you a lone understand the mystery of death comfort  our  loved one's hide them under your wings God.Sandwich them with  your presence.you are the best comforter.whisper to them in your  small still voice a reassurance that you are filling the vacuum created by the demise of Joseph. I pray for today's occasion, dear lord that your holyspirit  will take control of everything.Guide the caterers the Mc,the pastor and all guests  who are travelling grand them journey mercies. Let your presence be felt in every action.

I have  wondered why good people  go home early ?and I'm convinced  that good people and ear marked for heaven and the lord doesn't want them defiled on earth. He picks them early for his kingdom as we mourn the angels are celebrating for another  angel  has joined them.
R.I.P Joseph. Kona bulayi wandayase.till we meet again  Rest at  Jesus  feetüôèüèºüôèüèºüôèüèº

Ti

tributes.name: Juma Tellah
tributes.message: A close workmate @ ksaa and a board member at Kenya Ships Agent Association (KSAA) where I served as the CEO till April 2025. Met Joseph at his NISOMAR office a few days before taken. Once again, May the Almighty Allah Subhanna rest his soul and eternal peace - Ameen

tributes.name: Mwanjala
tributes.message: Aboo as we used to call each other,he was a man of integrity, loving, caring to our sister Irene, your legacy lives on Aboo, for you recognised who God was in your life, Rest well Aboo

tributes.name: Mbaru
tributes.message:
Be strong in the Lord and in his mighty power.
Sometimes you may feel overwhelmed with situations, you feel like giving up. I pray for more strength in the name of Jesus upon you.Amen
Ephesians 6:10

tributes.name: Fred
tributes.message:
May his precious soul rest in eternal peace
FRom God we came and to him we shall return

tributes.name: Beryl Grey
tributes.message:
That one call that you made to see me in your office and help with all your travel arrangements eight years ago seems just like yesterday. The news that I moved and started my own business to break the remaining barriers was the best and our conversations never stopped on how to navigate all aspects in business. 
Dear Joseph, you cheered me endlessly, you clapped for me , you encouraged me endlessly that I can , you supported me greatly.  Thank you for the opportunity ,for the mentoring and the unending support. It‚Äôs terrible losing you,but I accept the will of God . May your soul rest in perfect peace. May your wife , kids and siblings find peace . 
Heaven has gained an angel

tributes.name: Rebecca
tributes.message: Indeed he was a good man,how I wish a foundation is created with his name, let's keep his legacy and his name alive

tributes.name: Petterson Mittau
tributes.message: Rest in Peace Joseph Weloba. You have been very friendly to all and may the almighty God give Caroline and her beloved family strength at this unexpected period.

tributes.name: Matiba Kennedy Okumu
tributes.message: Poleni sana kwa familia ,mungu awape nguvu kwa wakati huu mgumu

tributes.name: Jips Kamau
tributes.message:
Joseph would call me whenever he was in Nairobi just for a chat. Many are times i would meet him outside business hours just for a man Talk.
He wasn't my boss.
He was my Dad.
He was my friend.
He used to call me Small brother!!
Rest in peace Senior!

tributes.name: Lydia munata
tributes.message: Your presence will highly be missed by the Nabubwaya associators.The way you loved and treated us while we were in Mombasa.You will forever be in our hearts.Rest in peace Mulamwa

tributes.name: Mutia Kiema
tributes.relationship: He was one of my loyal client together with his family,indeed was a generous man
tributes.message: he was joyful man and very supportive to my business

tributes.name: Silas Mazera
tributes.message:
Joseph was my very close friend / a brother  - i knew him in the early  2000 wen he was working at inchcape     shipping where they handled our commodity vessels...and would recommend to my overseas bosses to appoint inchcape because of him - how he used to give us special treatment../ services ....besides work joseph was like a bother - whenever we met any place he would tel me let's plan for coffee date .bro.....I remember my Indian boss used to tell me " dress smart like weloba" ! Ever smart 
I will really miss him - Rip bro

tributes.name: Nehemiah Shikuku
tributes.message:
Mr, Joseph was my Boss,but He took me as his own Son or younger brother.
For the duration of time I was under his care and supervision as a staff I felt a fatherly love from Him.
He was a kind person and cheerful giver.
I remember there is a time he asked me and I quote,'Shikuku Juma amekulipa mshahara?,' and I said yes ,then He said ,'Mwambie akuongeze seven thousand'.
This act left a Mark in my heart,not because of the additional amount,but He showed how he cared about people.
I have a lot to say but I don't know which one should come first in the second stanza.
I have lost a father,a brother and a role model.
May his Soul rest in eternal Peace.
Mr, Joseph even though you have gone but your good deeds liveth amongst us.

tributes.name: Prince Meshack Masika
tributes.message: Joseph was an open hearted man.I have come to terms that good men don't live long; God takes them earlier to avoid contamination of the world.For life is pleasant.Death is peaceful.That is the transition that is  troublesome.May your soul be promoted to glory Jose.

tributes.name: Gladys mueni
tributes.message: Forever you shall be remembered

tributes.name: Kalekye
tributes.message: Joseph was a good friend and mentor. He always encouraged me, was very supportive and proud of how far have come. He literally shaped my career. I will celebrate him always. Till we meet again Kiara. üò≠üòûüò¢

tributes.name: Aisha Omar
tributes.relationship: An extraordinary boss and friend to Me!
tributes.message:
During the course of my career I had the opportunity to work with Joseph Weloba. Weloba stood out as more than a boss, and more like a mentor and big brother to me. He remains one of the most amazing people that I had the privilege of working with.
During the years that we worked together, he always provided excellent professional advice and guidance on all matters that I would bring to him. Even though we stopped working together several years ago, he remained a friend and a mentor and would always offer support and stay in touch. He achieved all the qualities essential in a good leader and surpassed the expectations of a mentor.
I will always remember him with affection and respect.
Rest well dear friend and always smile down on us.
Heaven welcomes you with open arms!

tributes.name: Kililo
tributes.message:
I write this tribute in honor and celebration of the life of a remarkable man who brought so much joy, light and love into our lives. Nyongi, as we fondly called him, was not just a husband to our sister; he was a brother, a friend, and a most cherished part of our family. We loved him so much. And now that he is no longer with us, we still cling to that love which will live in our hearts forever. 

His kindness, laughter, and unwavering support will forever be etched in our hearts. He gave so much of himself, everything really. He welcomed us into his home and his heart. Whether it was his warm smile or his ability to make everyone feel welcome, he had a unique way of turning ordinary moments into cherished memories. We cannot forget the dinners we shared and family moments at the shamba. He had that innate ability to gather people. He, simply, was the best. Truly a man amomg men. 

His time with us was far too short. Far too short. Our hearts ache because we feel the big loss of his leaving. We just have to hold on to the love he shared and the impact he made which will remain with us forever.  We will forever carry his spirit and the lessons he taught us of love, resilience, and the importance of family in the depth of our hearts.

Rest in peace, dear Joseph. You will be deeply missed but never forgotten.

tributes.name: Pascal Mukachi
tributes.message: I remember his last call when I was heading to mombasa for secondary school games last term. Joseph welcomed me for dinner, but I missed this chance due to unavailable circumstances. Rest in peace n friend

tributes.name: Rev. Moses Muli
tributes.message:
I have known Joseph for over 5 years now. He was a kind-hearted person, always wearing a warm smile. Joseph was not just a member of the club ‚Äî he truly embraced our mission of caring for seafarers. The Mission to Seafarers was like a second home to him.

We have lost a dear friend and a dependable brother. His absence will be deeply felt, and he will be truly missed.

May God grant his family peace and comfort as they come to terms with this great loss.
Rev. Muli, chaplain

tributes.name: Samuel Wekesa Simiyu
tributes.message:
It is with a heavy heart that I pen this tribute to a man who was more than just a friend or neighbour‚ÄîJoseph was a brother, a mentor, and a remarkable presence in my life.

Back in the village, Joseph wasn‚Äôt just the familiar face next door; he was the one who genuinely cared, who shared laughter and wisdom in equal measure. He believed in people and went out of his way to lift others. I am a living testament to that.

When I needed an opportunity, Joseph gave me more than just a job‚Äîhe gave me a chance to grow. He opened the doors of Nisomar Ltd, trusting me to serve as an IT/Documentation Officer. Working under him was a privilege. He wasn‚Äôt just a boss; he was a listening leader, a visionary, and above all, a genuinely good human being. He guided with kindness, corrected with humility, and celebrated our small wins like they were his own.

His office was filled with warmth and open doors‚Äîboth literally and in spirit. Whether you were struggling or succeeding, Joseph was there‚Äîrooting for you, advising you, and cheering you on.

Losing him is not just a personal loss, but a great loss to everyone whose life he touched. The village has lost a gem, and many of us have lost a cornerstone of support and friendship.

Go thee well, Joseph.
Your legacy of kindness, leadership, and friendship will live on in our hearts.
You may be gone from our sight, but you will never be gone from our memories.

Farewell, brother. You‚Äôll forever be remembered.

tributes.name: Harry Arigi
tributes.message:
Knew Joseph from High School. We were fierce competitors in Basketball...I was in St. Peters Mumias, and he was in Friends School Kamusinga. We met again when he came to Mombasa. A very close pal. At the hospital, he talked of us having the final dance, a one-on-one with him, but God's plan prevailed.

I will miss you buddy...

tributes.name: Bishop Tom Wafula kingoro
tributes.message:
He was a good person and a role model to our community/kenya 
May his soul rest in peace üôè

tributes.name: Thomas W. Bifwoli
tributes.message: Joseph, a magnet and glue that brought us together. Such an awesome man. Forever Cherished. Go well bro.

tributes.name: Ronald Kerama
tributes.message: My thoughts are with you and your family during this sorrowful time. Your father's legacy will continue to shine brightly through the lives he touched.
